lexUnit.name: contrive.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: devise or plan using skill and artifice

sentence.text: So Yule and January passed , and the lord of Dalwolsey quite frequently caught himself wondering how he might contrive an excuse to pay another visit to the Doune of Menteith .
A DISGRACED professor who contrived a scheme to defraud the University of Stirling of almost £15,000 escaped a prison sentence yesterday after a sheriff heard he had paid the money back .
Architects with small and large reputations have contrived a scene of staggering proportions .
During his life Hampden contrived the execution of the King 's advisor the Earl of Strafford .
I have to contrive a dress for a Miss Hippisley-Smith who has a thirty-one-inch bust and forty-six-inch hips .
Elizabeth and Anne contrived a spit for Felix 's chickens and set them to roast .
Henry contrives guided missiles from acid rain test kit and launches attack on manger .
Sir Thomas will no longer be acting as go-between in the matter of correspondence , but the prince might well contrive some other means of communicating with you .
Here the Cornish ` tinners " contrived an ingenious scheme of tunnelling under the City and laying explosives to bring down the walls .

However , in the finale of his Six Small Piano Pieces Op. 19 Schoenberg contrived a different solution , which has the advantage of combining the smooth , static quality of harmony in fourths with the unexpected .
Dr. Prior felt that means of warming the room should be contrived so that the temperature at the commencement of the meal should not fall below 32° Fahrenheit .
Whatever nominal agreements might be contrived , only to be misread , there were repeated raids by one side upon the other in contravention of treaty terms .
Somehow on this rich , fertile island , a centrepiece has been contrived of dull concrete .
We have contrived the ` Big Bang " theory -- a typically western aggressive concept -- whereas the Hindus termed it ` the churning of the milky ocean " .
The last British government in Uganda , initially seeking an integrated state in recognition of local realities , was forced to contrive a more or less federal one .

Here , there 's another parador contrived from a 16th century building -- the Hostal de Reyes Catolicas , which was built by Ferdinand and Isabella as an inn for pilgrims and is still fulfilling its original purpose .
It also had a balancing mechanism contrived from two arching tubes at right angles to one another in a vertical plane .
It had been a very typical contract that Mark Letterworth had contrived in outline for the sale of the turbine engines to a Moscow factory .
She was a typical Fifties phenomenon , a celebrity contrived out of sex appeal and publicity alone , both of them rather naive and innocent by the standards of subsequent hype and hoop-la .
It was one of those pictures which are so contrived that the eyes follow you about when you move .
